results.title: ‘She Said’ Review: A Quiet Thriller That Speaks Volumes
results.abstract: Maria Schrader directs this adaptation of the book about reporters’ efforts to document sexual harassment by Harvey Weinstein.

multimedia.caption: Carey Mulligan, left, and Zoe Kazan as reporters trying to persuade women to talk about sexual harassment by Harvey Weinstein.
Carey Mulligan, left, and Zoe Kazan as reporters trying to persuade women to talk about sexual harassment by Harvey Weinstein.
Carey Mulligan, left, and Zoe Kazan as reporters trying to persuade women to talk about sexual harassment by Harvey Weinstein.

results.title: Tenoch Huerta Mejía and the Beauty of Representation in ‘Wakanda Forever’
results.abstract: The Mexican actor’s breakthrough moment playing Namor in the “Black Panther” sequel is especially gratifying for the antiracism activist.

multimedia.caption: Huerta has taken a lot of flak on social media for his antiracism comments, but he’s not deterred: “Do you think those comments have stopped me?”
multimedia.copyright: Elliott Jerome Brown Jr. for The New York Times

results.title: ‘The Wonder’ Review: The Hungry Woman
results.abstract: In this period drama, Florence Pugh plays a British nurse hired to observe an Irish girl who’s said not to have eaten in four months.

multimedia.caption: Florence Pugh, right, with Tom Burke carrying Kíla Lord Cassidy in “The Wonder,” an adaptation of Emma Donoghue’s novel of that name.
Florence Pugh, right, with Tom Burke carrying Kíla Lord Cassidy in “The Wonder,” an adaptation of Emma Donoghue’s novel of that name.
Florence Pugh, right, with Tom Burke carrying Kíla Lord Cassidy in “The Wonder,” an adaptation of Emma Donoghue’s novel of that name.

results.title: ‘The Inspection’ Review: Boot Camp, a Love Story
results.abstract: Elegance Bratton’s autobiographical first feature is a lyrical, wrenching look at a young Marine’s journey through basic training.

multimedia.caption: Jeremy Pope, left, and Raúl Castillo in “The Inspection,” directed by Elegance Bratton.
Jeremy Pope, left, and Raúl Castillo in “The Inspection,” directed by Elegance Bratton.
Jeremy Pope, left, and Raúl Castillo in “The Inspection,” directed by Elegance Bratton.

results.title: ‘EO’ Review: Imagining the Lives of Other Creatures
results.abstract: The titular character of this fantastic adventure is no Disneyfied, cutesy creature. The director Jerzy Skolimowski emphasizes his animality and un-knowableness.

multimedia.caption: This wild, boldly expressionistic movie conveys the life of its largely silent protagonist, EO the donkey, with a bare minimum of dialogue.
This wild, boldly expressionistic movie conveys the life of its largely silent protagonist, EO the donkey, with a bare minimum of dialogue.
This wild, boldly expressionistic movie conveys the life of its largely silent protagonist, EO the donkey, with a bare minimum of dialogue.

results.title: The Charming Star With Soulful Eyes Happens to Be a Donkey
results.abstract: The “EO” filmmakers wanted to tell their story via a silent animal but felt dogs or cats were clichéd. Their choice turned out to be anything but stubborn.

multimedia.caption: Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”
Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”
Tako was one of six donkeys sharing the title role in “EO.”

results.title: ‘The Menu’ Serves Fine Dining on a Skewer
results.abstract: A look at how the creators of the new satirical film took the already high-pressure world of elite restaurants to a thrilling and terrifying level.

multimedia.caption: Ralph Fiennes, as the tormented chef Julian Slowik, wrote a key speech about s’mores that parodies the language of haute cuisine.
Ralph Fiennes, as the tormented chef Julian Slowik, wrote a key speech about s’mores that parodies the language of haute cuisine.
Ralph Fiennes, as the tormented chef Julian Slowik, wrote a key speech about s’mores that parodies the language of haute cuisine.

results.title: ‘A Christmas Story Christmas’ Review: Nostalgia Is Fragile
results.abstract: The cast of the perennial holiday classic “A Christmas Story” returns for this half-baked legacy sequel.

multimedia.caption: From left, Erinn Hayes, River Drosche, Julianna Layne and Peter Billingsley in “A Christmas Story Christmas.”
From left, Erinn Hayes, River Drosche, Julianna Layne and Peter Billingsley in “A Christmas Story Christmas.”
From left, Erinn Hayes, River Drosche, Julianna Layne and Peter Billingsley in “A Christmas Story Christmas.”

results.title: ‘She Said’ Filmmakers and Weinstein Victims: An Emotional Collaboration
results.abstract: Though the drama avoids showing assaults or even much of the producer, a survivor likened reliving the experience to “watching your own car crash.”

multimedia.caption: The director Maria Schrader chose not to include scenes of Harvey Weinstein’s attacks: “I do not need to add another rape scene to the world.”
multimedia.copyright: Magdalena Wosinska for The New York Times

results.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a Bollywood murder mystery, an elliptical Portuguese documentary, a Chinese drama about gay hustlers and more.

results.title: Gentle Ukrainian Film Critic Is Drafted Into Vicious Real-Life War Movie
results.abstract: Anton Filatov was pulled into a theater he never expected or wanted to enter: the front lines of war, where he now writes movingly of the scene in the trenches instead of what’s on the screen.
results.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman and Oleksandra Mykolyshyn

multimedia.caption: Anton Filatov, left, a Ukrainian film critic turned soldier, in an abandoned house near the front in Donbas in August. He has kept writing throughout the war, though his subject has changed.
multimedia.copyright: Jim Huylebroek for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Anton Filatov, left, a Ukrainian film critic turned soldier, in an abandoned house near the front in Donbas in August. He has kept writing throughout the war, though his subject has changed.

results.title: ‘Slumberland’ Review: A Land of No Enchantment
results.abstract: This ostensible family entertainment stars Marlow Barkley and Jason Momoa, and is directed with the delicacy of a flying mallet.

results.title: ‘Bad Axe’ Review: A Pandemic Family Portrait
results.abstract: The filmmaker David Siev chronicles his family’s struggle to keep their Michigan restaurant afloat through the pandemic in this hermetic documentary.

results.abstract: The one-acts that make up Andrew Bujalski’s film percolate with sly humor, decency, curiosity and sheer nerve.

results.title: In Andy Warhol’s ‘My Hustler,’ Love Is for Sale
results.abstract: The artist’s scurrilously satirical treatment of male prostitution proved an underground hit after it premiered in 1966.

results.title: Nan Goldin and Laura Poitras: Two Artists, One Devastating Film
results.abstract: The documentary “All the Beauty and the Bloodshed” tells a complex story of personal trauma and protest. But first the collaborators needed to reach an agreement.

results.title: ‘In Her Hands’ Review: A Young Woman’s Resolve as Life Unravels
results.abstract: Hillary and Chelsea Clinton executive produced this documentary, which follows a young Afghan mayor as she navigates upheavals wrought by the Taliban’s return to power.

results.title: ‘Memories of My Father’ Review: Death of a Patriarch
results.abstract: Directed by Fernando Trueba, this treacly melodrama focuses on the Colombian writer Héctor Abad Faciolince’s coming-of-age as shaped by his father, the doctor and human rights leader Héctor Abad Gómez.

multimedia.caption: Javier Cámara, right, with Nicolás Reyes Cano, left, in “Memories of My Father.”

results.title: Kevin Spacey Faces New Sexual Assault Charges in U.K.
results.abstract: The authorities authorized seven new counts against the actor, including three for sexual assault. Mr. Spacey was already facing a criminal trial in Britain.

multimedia.caption: The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.
The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.
The actor Kevin Spacey attended a hearing at the Central Criminal Court in London in July over charges of sexual assault.

results.title: How ‘The Lion King’ Got to Broadway and Ruled for 25 Years (So Far)
results.abstract: A surprising collaboration between an entertainment giant (Disney) and an avant-garde artist (Julie Taymor) birthed the most successful musical in history.

multimedia.caption: Julie Taymor, who not only directed the show but also designed its costumes, puppets and masks, became the first woman to win a Tony Award for directing a musical. “I like challenges,” she said of the project.

Julie Taymor, who not only directed the show but also designed its costumes, puppets and masks, became the first woman to win a Tony Award for directing a musical. “I like challenges,” she said of the project.

results.abstract: In his documentary, Jonah Hill gently turns the tables on the psychiatrist and author Phil Stutz.

results.title: ‘Master of Light’ Review: Rebuilding Through Rembrandt
results.abstract: The painter George Anthony Morton, who spent his 20s in prison on a drug conviction, is the subject of this documentary coming to HBO Max.

results.title: Mehran Karimi Nasseri, Who Inspired ‘The Terminal,’ Dies in Paris Airport
results.abstract: He slept on a bench in Charles de Gaulle Airport for 18 years, stuck in limbo as a refugee. His story inspired a Steven Spielberg film with Tom Hanks.

multimedia.caption: Mehran Karimi Nasseri in 2004 at Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris standing by the poster of the movie that was inspired by his life. He died on Saturday inside the airport.
multimedia.copyright: Stephane De Sakutin/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images
